Protocols/STPPaymentContextDelegate.html.name: -paymentContextDidChange:
Protocols/STPPaymentContextDelegate.html.abstract: This is called every time the contents of the payment context change. When this is called, you should update your app’s UI to reflect the current state of the payment context. For example, if you have a checkout page with a selected payment method row, you should update its payment method with paymentContext.selectedPaymentOption.label. If that checkout page has a buy button, you should enable/disable it depending on the result of [paymentContext isReadyForPayment].

Protocols/STPPaymentContextDelegate.html.name: -paymentContext:didCreatePaymentResult:completion:
Protocols/STPPaymentContextDelegate.html.abstract: Inside this method, you should make a call to your backend API to make a PaymentIntent with that Customer + payment method, and invoke the completion block when that is done.

Protocols/STPPaymentContextDelegate.html.name: -paymentContext:didFinishWithStatus:error:
Protocols/STPPaymentContextDelegate.html.abstract: This is invoked by an STPPaymentContext when it is finished. This will be called after the payment is done and all necessary UI has been dismissed. You should inspect the returned status and behave appropriately. For example: if it’s STPPaymentStatusSuccess, show the user a receipt. If it’s STPPaymentStatusError, inform the user of the error. If it’s STPPaymentStatusUserCanceled, do nothing.
